items.public_summary: Ensure all employees receive security and privacy awareness training, incident response training, and are familiar with all relevant policies and procedures.
Require role-specific training for high risk roles, including at least roles with privileged access.
Require role-specific training for development and engineering staff covering best practices for delivering secure software.
Log and monitor service modifications.
Execute changes though redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible.
Implement persistent automated testing and validation of changes.
Consistently follow a documented change management procedure.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-CMT-04/Appendix H - Configuration Management Plan (CMP) - CMP-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Evaluate the risk and potential impact of any change.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-CMT-05/Appendix H - Configuration Management Plan (CMP) - CMP-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Configure ALL machine-based information resources to limit inbound and outbound traffic.
Design systems to minimize the attack surface and minimize lateral movement if compromised.
Use logical networking and related capabilities to enforce traffic flow controls.
Use immutable infrastructure with strictly defined functionality and privileges by default.
Protect against denial of service attacks and unwanted spam.
Design systems for high availability and rapid recovery.
Ensure cloud-native information resources are implemented based on host provider"s best practices and documented guidance.
Use automated services to persistently assess the security posture of all services and automatically enforce secure operations.
Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) using methods that are difficult to intercept or impersonate (phishing-resistant MFA) for all user authentication.
Use secure passwordless methods for user authentication and authorization when feasible, otherwise enforce strong passwords with MFA.
Enforce appropriately secure authentication methods for non-user accounts and services.
Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time security authorization model for all user and non-user accounts and services.
Design identity and access management systems that assume resources will be compromised.
Automatically disable or otherwise secure accounts with privileged access in response to suspicious activity.
Securely manage the lifecycle and privileges of all accounts, roles, and groups.
Respond to incidents according to FedRAMP requirements and cloud service provider policies.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-INR-01/Appendix I - Incident Response Plan - IRP-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-INR-02/Appendix I - Incident Response Plan - IRP-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Generate after action reports and regularly incorporate lessons learned into operations.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-INR-03/Appendix I - Incident Response Plan - IRP-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Operate a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) or similar system(s) for centralized, tamper-resistent logging of events, activities, and changes.
Regularly review and audit logs.
Rapidly detect and respond to vulnerabilities following requirements and recommendations in the FedRAMP Vulnerability Response and Detection standard.
Perform Infrastructure as Code and configuration evaluation and testing.
Maintain a list of information resources and event types that will be monitored, logged, and audited.
Use a least-privileged, role and attribute-based, and just-in-time access authorization model for access to log data.
Generate inventories of information resources from authoritative sources.
Document the security objectives and requirements for each information resource.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-PIY-02/Appendix C - Information Security Policies and Procedures (ISPP) - ISPP-01_1.pdf
evidence/KSI-PIY-02/Appendix P - Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (C-SCRM) Program - C-SCRM-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Maintain a vulnerability disclosure program.
Build security and privacy considerations into the Software Development Lifecycle and align with CISA Secure By Design principles.
Document methods used to evaluate information resource implementations.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-PIY-05/Appendix C - Information Security Policies and Procedures (ISPP) - ISPP-01_1.pdf

items.public_summary: Have staff and budget for security commensurate with the size, complexity, scope, executive priorities, and risk of the service offering that demonstrates commitment to delivering a secure service.

items.public_summary: Document risk management decisions for software supply chain security.

items.public_summary: Define Recovery Time Objectives (RTO) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPO).
Develop and maintain a recovery plan that aligns with the defined recovery objectives.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-RPL-02/Appendix I - Incident Response Plan - IRP-01_0.pdf
evidence/KSI-RPL-02/Appendix G - Information System Contingency Plan (ISCP) - ISCP-01_1.pdf

items.public_summary: Perform system backups aligned with recovery objectives.
Regularly test the capability to recover from incidents and contingencies.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-RPL-04/Appendix G - Information System Contingency Plan (ISCP) - ISCP-01_1.pdf

items.public_summary: Continuously evaluate machine-based information resources for opportunities to improve security.
Encrypt or otherwise secure network traffic.
Encrypt information at rest by default.
Manage configuration of machine-based information resources using automation.
Use cryptographic methods to validate the integrity of machine-based information resources.
Use automated key management systems to manage, protect, and regularly rotate digital keys and certificates.
Use a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying security patches.
Ensure that changes do not introduce or leave behind residual elements that could negatively affect confidentiality, integrity, or availability of information resources.
Use mechanisms that continuously validate the authenticity and integrity of communications between information resources.
Remove unwanted information promptly, including from backups if appropriate.
Follow the requirements and recommendations in the FedRAMP Minimum Assessment Standard regarding third-party information resources.
Identify and prioritize mitigation of potential supply chain risks.

restricted_artifacts.path: evidence/KSI-TPR-03/Appendix P - Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (C-SCRM) Program - C-SCRM-01_0.pdf

items.public_summary: Monitor third party software information resources for upstream vulnerabilities, with contractual notification requirements or active monitoring services.
